meanings.definition: Causing dizziness or a sensation of spinning.
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster ride was vertiginous, making me feel dizzy.
meanings.sent2: The tall building's vertiginous height made me feel a bit unsteady.
meanings.sent3: The spinning teacup ride was so vertiginous, it left me feeling woozy.
meanings.sent4: The vertiginous whirl of colors in the kaleidoscope mesmerized me.
meanings.sent5: The vertiginous sensation of falling in a dream woke me up in a panic.

meanings.definition: Characterized by vertigo or a feeling of instability.
meanings.sent1: The patient's vertiginous symptoms included a spinning sensation.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge swayed in a vertiginous manner, causing unease.
meanings.sent3: The wobbly table gave a vertiginous feel to the dining experience.
meanings.sent4: The vertiginous uncertainty of the situation left everyone anxious.
meanings.sent5: The vertiginous feeling of being on a boat in rough waters made her queasy.

meanings.sent1: The mountain had a vertiginous peak that seemed to touch the sky.
meanings.sent2: The cliff's vertiginous drop made my heart race.
meanings.sent3: The price of the luxury car was so vertiginous, it made me gasp.
meanings.sent4: The vertiginous climb to the top of the tower was worth the breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The vertiginous slope of the ski hill challenged even the most experienced skiers.
